result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry A Stein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bail applied to costs.  Paid in full.  Remainder of bail to be applied to case 15CF1471.

Straight time to commence FORTHWITH.  Sentence credit for 144 days were granted.
Concurrent with: any other sentence.

records.addlTxt: Stipulation and Order for Substitution of Attorneys, Atty Wolff for Atty Williamson.  Signed by Judge Ralph M. Ramirez on March 24, 2016

Defendant Terry A Stein in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses the fact attorney Wolff is new to this case.  Defendant wishes to proceed forward to sentencing today.  Court steps down so Attorney Bayer can check into his notes on this case.  Case recalled at 9:51 am.  
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1. 
Sentence of:
12 months jail.  (Credit - 144 days).  Commences immediately.  Concurrent to any other sentence. 
COSTS:  $268.00 Bail to be applied.
DNA previously done. 
Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing at 03-18-2016 09:30 am

Case called for a sentencing hearing.  Defendant Terry A Stein in court, in custody, with attorney Chelsea Williamson.   Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Williamson moves for an adjournment until after sentencing in Milwaukee County.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Jail Inmate Communication Form filed by defendant regarding court date. (copy sent to Defendant Atty and District Attorney's office)
January 28, 2016 response letter sent to Terry Stein
received January 27, 2016 Jail Inmate Communication Form filed by defendant regarding sentencing
Sentencing hearing at 02-15-2016 08:30 am
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Terry A Stein in court, in custody, with attorney Chelsea Williamson.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State is not compliant with victims rights regulations.  Court adjourns sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-13-2016 01:30 pm

Defendant Terry A Stein in court, in custody, with attorney Chelsea Williamson.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant will be going through with his Milwaukee Case until 1/29.  
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

$1,000.00 PREVIOUSLY POSTED.  DEFENDANT NEEDS TO POST AN ADDITIONAL $1,000.00 TO BE RELEASED.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.

Defendant Terry A Stein in court, in custody, with attorney Chelsea Williamson.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has new charges.  Attorney Williamson moves for the cashbail posted to be refunded to the poster.  State makes recommendations to new bail amount.  Court raises the cashbail to $2,000.00.  Court will address the return of the $1,000.00 cashbail previously posted on a different date.
